citation.article-title: Solitalea koreensis gen. nov., sp. nov. and the reclassification of [Flexibacter] canadensis as Solitalea canadensis comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Solitalea koreensis sp. nov.
Solitalea koreensis (ko.re.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. koreensis pertaining to Korea, from where the organism was isolated).
Exhibits the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells are 0.5–0.6 μm wide and 1.3–30 μm long.
Colonies are light yellow and irregular.
Grows at 10–35 °C, in the presence of 0–1 % (w/v) NaCl and at pH 5–8.
Optimum growth occurs at 28–30 °C and pH 6.0–7.0.
Does not hydrolyse casein, CM-cellulose or DNA.
Positive for gelatin hydrolysis, β-galactosidase and Voges–Proskauer test.

Negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease, aesculin hydrolysis, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, citrate utilization, H2S production and tryptophan deaminase (API 20NE and API 20E test strips).
Assimilative reactions and enzymic activities are shown in Table 2.
Predominant fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, summed feature 3 and C15 : 1ω6c.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 38.1 mol%.
The type strain, R2A36-4T (=KACC 12953T=DSM 21342T), was isolated from a greenhouse soil sample collected from Yongin region, Republic of Korea.
